News

November 2016

  • 23.11.16 - Vladan Stevanovic visited us from NREL / Colorado School of Mines and shared his wisdom on high-throughput computations.
  • 20.11.16 - It has been an exciting month for research: we have a perspective on conductive MOFs in MRS Bulletin, insights into the role of entropy in perovskites published in PRB Rapid Communications, and the inaugural publication for our code SMACT in the new journal Chem.

October 2016

  • 11.10.16 - We are now fully set up at Imperial College London in the historic Royal School of Mines building. It is another busy month for science including a collaboration with Columbia University on order-disorder behaviour of hybrid perovskites published in ACS Energy Letters, and a shiny new interatomic potential by Jess for metal-organic frameworks that can describe phonon behaviour in PCCP.
  • 01.10.16 - The Royal Society have kindly funded a three-year extension of Aron’s University Research Fellowship, which starts today.

September 2016

  • 25.09.16 - The first book dedicated to organic-inorganic halide perovskite solar cells has been published by Springer. We contributed Chapter 1!
  • 07.09.16 - What effect does spin-orbit coupling actually have on electron-hole recombination in perovskite solar cells? Pooya wrote a code to find out.

August 2016

  • 14.08.16 - It has been an exciting summer! Congrats to Federico on passing his PhD examination. Jessica is ready to submit her thesis. New computers were ordered for our labs at Imperial College London. On top of all that, our work on phonon anharmonicity in SnSe was just published in Physical Review Letters.

July 2016

  • 12.07.16 - What happens to thermal conductivity as more elements are introduced but the average mass is conserved? We now know the answer thanks to Taizo and Jonathan’s study in APL Materials.

June 2016

  • 21.06.16 - We have been delighted to collaborate with Ken Sakai on Pt chain compounds, which appeared today in Nature Communications.

May 2016

  • 01.04.16 - Clovis’ study of four-component oxide perovskite alloys has been published in Physical Review B.

April 2016

  • 28.04.16 - Why are d0 metal-organic frameworks photoactive? Find out in Scientific Reports, in collaboration with Delft University.
  • 17.04.16 - Jess has been working hard on defects in MOFs and her study of UiO-66 is in Journal of Physical Chemistry C, our first collaboration with Curtin University.
  • 02.04.16 - Aron, Dan and Jonathan delivered a course on Advanced Materials for Solar Energy at Yonsei University to 22 enthusiastic postgraduate students.

March 2016

  • 30.03.16 - While Aron, Jonathan and Dan are in Korea, our introduction to materials design has been published in Chemical Society Reviews, while a perspective on kesterite solar cells appeared in Advanced Energy Materials.
  • 15.03.16 - V-VI-VII semiconductors are heating up this week. Sb compounds in Applied Physics Letters and Bi compounds in Chemistry of Materials and Chemical Science!
  • 08.03.16 - Federico and Clovis explain the unusual behaviour of mixed halide perovskites in Journal of Physical Chemistry Letters this week.

February 2016

  • 19.02.16 - Aron has been appointed as a Fellow of the Royal Society of Chemistry.
  • 17.02.16 - The group has been successful in two PRACE projects that provide access to the largest European supercomputers: one on photoferroics and one on metastable switches. Happy computing!
  • 10.02.16 - We have contributed to a special issue of Accounts of Chemical Research on the dynamics inside perovskite solar cells.
  • 08.02.16 - Keith’s paper on screening photovoltaic contacts has made it onto the cover of Journal of Materials Chemistry!

January 2016

  • 27.01.16 - The issue of characterising mixed-ligand metal-organic frameworks has been solved through collaboration with Collège de France in Chemistry: A European Journal this week.
  • 21.01.16 - Jarvist’s work on polar domains in CH3NH3PbI3 has been named as the most accessed APL Materials article in 2015.
  • 14.01.16 - A collaboration with UCL has explored the potential photovoltaic materials BiSI and BiSeI in Journal of Materials Chemistry.
  • 08.01.16 - Keith spent last summer at Tokyo Institute of Technology, which has resulted in a new method and paper on screening solar cell interfaces in Journal of Materials Chemistry.
  • 07.01.16 - Lee finalised a study into the layered dichalcogenide SnS2 with Liverpool and Bristol in Journal of Materials Chemistry.
  • 06.01.16 - Jess shows how the pore geometry of metal-organic frameworks can be controlled by composition with the Burrows group in a special issue of Dalton Transactions.
  • 05.01.16 - A new study of Raman scattering in ZnS/ZnSe alloys in collaboration with IREC is published in PCCP.
  • 04.01.16 - A collaboration with the Cheetham group on the chemical bonding of ferroelectric formate perovskite frameworks appears in Chemistry of Materials.
  • 03.01.16 - Adam reports a new chemical potential to describe sulfur vapours in Chemical Science.
  • 02.01.16 - A collaboration with KCL and ICL on the optical properties of CH3NH3PbI3 is published in Nanoscale.
  • 01.01.16 - The new website goes live. Goodbye iWeb, hello Jekyll.
